titles.title: To authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to terminate certain easements held by the Secretary on land owned by the Village of Caseyville, Illinois, and to terminate associated contractual arrangements with the Village.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation, Credit, Energy, and Research.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Conservation, Credit, Energy, and Research Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Agriculture. H. Rept. 111-253.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 141.

action.text: Mr. Holden moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 511.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

calendar.text: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry

action.text: Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry. Reported by Senator Lincoln without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 232.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 8/16/2010--Public Law. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture (USDA) to terminate any easement held by the Secretary on land owned by the Village of Caseyville, Illinois, and terminate associated contractual arrangements with the Village.
